articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Tehran's almost 10 million residents must now decide whether to shelter in their homes or attempt to leave.
articles.title: Trump's order to leave Tehran adds to fear as Iranians share 'last photo of home'

articles.description: Aryan Asari just wanted to film planes flying in the sky  - but he ended up capturing one of the country's biggest air crashes.
articles.title: Air India crash: The teen who filmed the Ahmedabad plane video the world saw

articles.description: The man who was given a restraining order for stalking Emma Raducanu has been blocked from applying for Wimbledon tickets.
articles.title: Emma Raducanu: Stalker blocked from applying for Wimbledon tickets

articles.description: The alerts covers most of England and warns of an impact on health and social care due to high temperatures.
articles.title: Yellow heat health alerts issued for most of England with heatwave likely

articles.description: The prime minister tells the BBC his decision to hold an inquiry was "practical, common sense politics".
articles.title: Keir Starmer defends U-turn on grooming gangs inquiry

articles.title: Israel's smaller, sophisticated military opposes larger Iran

articles.title: Britons stranded in Israel as Iranian strikes continue

articles.description: The Amazon founder and Lauren Sánchez are due to tie the knot next week - as activists say Venice is being turned into an "asset" for the rich and famous.
